title: Jacob Elordi's Accent Practice and Film Premiere Insights
summary: Jacob Elordi, a 28-year-old Australian actor, is starring as Heathcliffe in the new film adaptation of Wuthering Heights by Emily Brontë, set in Yorkshire. To master the Northern accent required for his role, he practices repeatedly in the bath, emphasizing words like 'mek' and 'tek'. The film, directed by Emerald Fennell, also features Margot Robbie and has generated controversy over its casting and BDSM-inspired scenes. At the London premiere, fans gathered to see the stars, with Leicester Square decorated to mimic Yorkshire's moors and a charcoal black red carpet for a gothic atmosphere. Singer Charli XCX, who wrote an album for the film including tracks like Chains of Love, discussed her transition from her upbeat Brat album to the darker themes of Wuthering Heights, citing influences from artists like Kate Bush. The article highlights the creative processes behind the film and its cultural impact.
